verses.roman:
kathayāṁ cakratur gāthāḥ
pūrvā guru-kule satoḥ
ātmanor lalitā rājan
karau gṛhya parasparam

synonyms: kathayām cakratuḥ—they discussed; gāthāḥ—topics; pūrvāḥ—of the past; guru-kule—in the school of their spiritual master; satoḥ—who used to reside; ātmanoḥ—of themselves; lalitāḥ—charming; rājan—O King (Parīkṣit); karau—hands; gṛhya—taking hold of; parasparam—each other's.
translation: [Śukadeva Gosvāmī continued:] Taking each other's hands, O King, Kṛṣṇa and Sudāmā talked pleasantly about how they once lived together in the school of their guru.
